Metadata: Withering syndrome and restoration of southern California abalone populations
"Withering Syndrome and Restoration of Southern California Abalone Populations," CalCOFI Report, Volume 43, pp. 112-117, 2002.

Withering syndrome is a chronic wasting disease of California abalone ("Haliotis" spp.) first observed in the Channel Islands in the mid-1980's. This article reviews the current state of knowledge regarding withering syndrome: phylogeny, origins, factors affecting disease expression, and abalone restoration approaches.
